info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued January 02 at 4:03PM EST until January 02 at 9:00PM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM EST FOR NORTH CENTRAL DECATUR...MILLER...NORTHWESTERN BAKER... SOUTHEASTERN CALHOUN...NORTHERN SEMINOLE AND CENTRAL EARLY COUNTIES IN SOUTHWESTERN GEORGIA... At 403 PM EST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Leary to near Donalsonville, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Colquitt, Donalsonville, Leary, Douglasville, Centerville, Iron City, Damascus, Brinson, Jakin, Babcock, Iveys Mill, Little Hope, Mayhaw, Holt, Boykin, Riverturn, Sharphagen, Donaldsonville A/P, Hentown and Rowena. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EST for southeastern Alabama...the Panhandle of Florida...and southwestern Georgia. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Tallahassee.
